H0.text: When was curling first played as a Winter Olympic sport. 1924

H1.text: When was curling first played as a Winter Olympic sport. 1932

H2.text: When was curling first played as a Winter Olympic sport. 1952

H3.text: When was curling first played as a Winter Olympic sport. 1998

A4.text: Curling was included in the program of the inaugural Winter Olympic Games in 1924 in Chamonix

A5.text: The sport was finally added to the official program for the 1998 Games in Nagano

A6.text: In 2006, the IOC confirmed that the medals awarded to the 1924 curling and military patrol teams were official

A7.text: However, no such designation was made in 1924

A8.text: The 1924 Winter Olympics included curling as a demonstration event, not a medal sport.

A9.text: Curling was first played as a medal sport in the 1998 Winter Olympics in Nagano.

A10.text: Curling was one of the original five Winter Olympic Sports.
